actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A bill to set forth principles for United States nationals involved in industrial cooperation projects in the Soviet Union and the Baltic States, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Slepak Principles Act - Expresses the sense of the Congress that U.S. nationals involved in industrial cooperation projects, especially joint ventures, in the Soviet Union and the Baltic States should adhere to the Slepak Principles and thus: (1) not use goods produced by forced labor; (2) seek the protection of human rights as it relates to Soviet employee rights; (3) decline to participate in any project if it uses a structure used for religious activities; (4) pose no danger to Soviet employees; and (5) seek private cooperatives as partners in such projects. Requires the Secretary of State to submit to the Congress an annual report with respect to such projects.
